newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates sees Q4 revs at $1.2 bln.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates sees Q4 revs at $1.2 bln.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc told analysts on Friday that it expected fourth quarter revenues to reach about $1.2 billion and saw the estimate of $0.89 per share for the quarter to be "achievable," according to an analyst, who participated in the company's conference call.
For the same period last year, the software company posted earnings of $1.05 per share on revenues of $1.1 billion.
The company's shares tumbled 12-3/4 to 49 in late trading on the New York Stock Exchange. The company was not immediately available to confirm the projections.
On Thursday, Computer Associates said it expected its third-quarter revenues to be between $1 billion and $1.1 billion, below the consensus estimate of $1.2 billion.
The company, which cited softness in European sales, said it still expected to reach the quarterly earnings estimate of $0.75 per share.
